dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 413 IH: Combating High Inflation Limiting Daycare Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Bice (for herself, Ms. Sánchez, Mr. Feenstra, Ms. Houlahan, Mr. Moolenaar, Mr. Nunn of Iowa, Mr. Torres of New York, and Mr. Magaziner) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to index dependent care assistance programs to inflation.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Combating High Inflation Limiting Daycare Act of 2025 or the CHILD Act of 2025.

section.header: Increased maximum contribution to dependent care assistance programs

subsection.text: Section 129(a)(2)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking $5,000 ($2,500 and inserting $10,000 ($5,000.
Section 129 of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: Each dollar amount in this section shall be increased by an amount equal to—

subparagraph.text: the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which such taxable year begins, determined by substituting calendar year 2023 for calendar year 2016 in subparagraph (A)(ii) thereof.

paragraph.text: If any increase under paragraph (1) is not a multiple of $50, such increase shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of $50.

subsection.text: Section 129(a)(2) of such Code is amended by striking subparagraph (D).
The amendments made by this section shall apply to calendar years beginning after December 31, 2024.
